item.title: K+S Cuts Guidance on Lower Potash Prices
item.description: K+S shares fell sharply after the fertilizer company cut its outlook for 2023, warning it expects prices in its agriculture segment to be tangibly lower for the year as a whole than they were in the first quarter.

item.title: China Expels Canadian Diplomat in Retaliatory Move
item.description: The action is the latest salvo in turbulent relations between the two countries, once strong partners in trade whose ties have substantially been eroded by geopolitics.

item.title: Chinese Exports Cool in Latest Warning Sign on Global Trade
item.description: Chinese export growth slowed in April as global trade cooled.

item.title: Saudi Aramco's Profit Slides as Oil Boom Cools
item.description: The energy giant’s earnings fell 19% in the first quarter, as concerns over a slowing global economy and a gusher of cheaper Russian crude supplies weighed on oil prices.

item.title: UBS Refreshes Management Team to Integrate Credit Suisse
item.description: The Swiss banking giant said it is evaluating all options for Credit Suisse’s Swiss business, which some politicians in the country want to be spun off into a separate unit or divested.

item.title: Nintendo Projects Profit Drop on Weaker Switch, Software Sales
item.description: The Japanese company projected a 21% decline in fiscal-year net profit.

item.title: Endesa Keeps Outlook After Strong First Quarter
item.description: Endesa posted above-forecast underlying earnings of €1.5 billion in the first quarter, despite slightly lower revenue, and confirmed its guidance for the year.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 1.0%, Led by Steel Stocks, Trading Houses
item.description: Japanese stocks ended broadly higher, led by steel stocks and trading houses, as several strong corporate results raised hopes for earnings growth.

item.title: Fresenius Profits Fall; Maintains Revenue Guidance
item.description: Fresenius reported higher first-quarter sales but a drop in operating income to €787 million and said it continued to expect organic revenue to grow in a low-to-mid single digit percentage range.

item.title: Market Looks More Optimistic About Rate Cuts Than Fed
item.description: In general, the market is much more optimistic about interest-rate developments than the Fed, DJE Kapital said, which for the time being sticks to a rather short duration bias.

item.title: Goldman Sachs to Pay $215 Million to Settle Female Employees' Discrimination Case
item.description: The Wall Street bank will also engage an independent expert to review its pay practices and employee performance evaluations.

item.title: UBS Outlines Leadership Team Ahead of Credit Suisse Deal
item.description: UBS said Ulrich Koerner, current Credit Suisse CEO, will join the UBS executive board once the takeover is closed, while Todd Tuckner will take on the role of CFO.

item.title: Daimler Truck Boosted by Strong Demand
item.description: Daimler Truck posted sharply higher underlying earnings of €1.1 billion in the first quarter on strong demand and as global supply chains improved.

item.title: Israeli Airstrikes Kill Three Palestinian Commanders in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli military said the airstrikes were part of a new operation against senior Palestinian Islamic Jihad commanders.

item.title: Sterling Gains as Market Bets on Further BOE Rate Rises
item.description: Sterling edged higher with the market expecting at least two further BOE rate rises, but Commerzbank said there is a risk of a downside correction as the expectations “seem quite ambitious.”

item.title: Tyson Foods swung to a quarterly loss and cut its sales forecast for the year amid high costs across its business and deteriorating consumer demand.
item.description: Tyson Foods swung to a quarterly loss and cut its sales forecast for the year amid high costs across its business and deteriorating consumer demand.

item.title: The Nasdaq edged up 0.2% to return to bull-market territory, while the S&P 500 eked out a gain of 0.05%. The Dow slipped 0.2%.
item.description: The Nasdaq edged up 0.2% to return to bull-market territory, while the S&P 500 eked out a gain of 0.05%. The Dow slipped 0.2%.

item.title: Ukraine said Monday that it had shot down more than two dozen drones above Kyiv overnight, as Russia intensifies strikes that seek to degrade its rival's air defenses ahead of an expected spring offensive by Ukrainian forces.
item.description: Ukraine said Monday that it had shot down more than two dozen drones above Kyiv overnight, as Russia intensifies strikes that seek to degrade its rival’s air defenses ahead of an expected spring offensive by Ukrainian forces.

item.title: Zoltan Pozsar, a widely followed Credit Suisse markets guru, has left the bank, part of an exodus of staff that began in the months before the lender's takeover by UBS.
item.description: Zoltan Pozsar, a widely followed Credit Suisse markets guru, has left the bank, part of an exodus of staff that began in the months before the lender’s takeover by UBS.

item.title: VW named insider Peter Bosch to head its struggling software unit as part of a broader overhaul of how the company develops the software for its cars.
item.description: VW named insider Peter Bosch to head its struggling software unit as part of a broader overhaul of how the company develops the software for its cars.
